intro: Veronica hospita, commonly known as the creeping speedwell, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features slender, creeping stems that root at the nodes, forming dense mats of foliage. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Veronica hospita is well adapted to rocky and gravelly soils, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens and coastal areas.
